Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior (now worn) is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394717) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394717)
